conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine the direction of motion.
The y-axis represents velocity in meters per second (m/s) and the x-axis represents time in seconds (s).
From 2 to 3 seconds, the velocity is negative (below the x-axis).
A positive velocity indicates motion in the positive direction. A negative velocity indicates motion in the opposite direction.
Since the velocity is negative from 2 to 3 seconds, the particle is moving in the direction opposite to the defined positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
